AA12234D78784DB9B026C85A8B5B401F.description:
Identify the problem(s) and document the findings and resolution. Include an explanation of
the common symptoms, diagnostic procedures, and specific tools used that led to the
problem resolution.

DF171F0F644C4ED69A8198A45DF3B31B.description:
Physical connectivity problems (e.g., connectors, wiring, split cables, cable
placement)

74E584440A7841CA9D303251DB11EFE5.description: Router and switch problems (e.g., switching loop, bad cables, port configuration)

B43D6107FC5D464F86B41005157F9360.description: Wireless problems (e.g., interference, signal strength, configurations, latency)

BCC2E1D8F25D44229F9F6AE332464B38.description:
For a given assignment related to the following common problems, follow the
troubleshooting theory using appropriate hardware and software tools (e.g., cable tester,
butt set, multimeter, protocol analyzer, throughput testers, connectivity software, etc.).

0A27947DA7BF4D9AB8404C391CEA0041.description:
Following the steps of the general troubleshooting theory, select a problem to present to
classmates as a case study.

58055B780B9E48F1B726FA5C9B583AED.description: Document findings, resolution, and preventative maintenance plan

1E2F27C634CF4C8DA58EA8562D27A2BD.description: Verify that the problem was resolved and prevent a future occurrence

B26736C255914432B2A6F481869F4AD6.description: Plan a solution and resolve the problem

20D02BE25D714868BA83ED8D6E453081.description: Isolate the cause of the problem and generate alternative solutions

76130F91C9554D3E96ED1197DC88929A.description: Verify the problem exists and how many users are affected

89107EF2267F4543A747C91A23AE4BAC.description: Gather information from users or the system, back up data, and document findings

F7663885D034412CBAB9BDC3C6FA1F46.description: For each network system problem given, apply the following general troubleshooting theory.

ACE6B2788BA54050879FAA834225A979.description:
Identify those aspects that are most influential on fault tolerance and justify the claim with
supporting evidence. Demonstrate the application of these practices and compare the
changes (if any) in the tolerance to results generated by other classmates.

8592F8573D1349998190580C5526AE9D.description:
Define fault tolerance, distinguishing between failures and faults in a network. Write a paper
describing the following aspects that should be monitored and managed to sustain fault
tolerance.

BDB59F2F6817459084197A318466E97C.description:
Explore the application of firewalls to secure networks. Describe their features and functions
while distinguishing between the types (e.g., software and hardware). Install and configure a
basic firewall. Verbally explain each step of the implementation process as it is executed.
Cite any applicable industry standards.

EF14D6E341D34803B7D2A73F232C2055.description:
Given various scenarios, identify the most applicable best practices to secure a network.
Implement these practices and write a justification for each scenario solution. Provide
supporting evidence drawing on industry standards.

1FEC1C478B8449669E635C3F9251965D.description:
Research and describe the most common security risks associated with people; data
transmission and hardware; protocols and software; and internet access. Investigate and
distinguish among the following common prevention methods to secure a network system.

131FEAB229744B1FB6C56C3267ADD528.description: Implement the security plan for the duration of the course, revising as necessary.

BD164DD636B442E1A56EFB24123A8D9E.description: How security breaches will be addressed

C76A4B49E2A7436B9BA1737D3018FA34.description: Rating system to assess the security threats

6F362ED857E54B96A03AAA87A6FEFE95.description: How often and when the audit will be conducted

B8A5DA5B792C47738D2C0E2BA7F6A430.description:
Develop a plan for a regularly scheduled audit to examine a network’s security risks. The
plan should include, but is not limited to, the following:

7B7D334E6BF448EE8DC19AFA1C2AA580.description: Present the paper to other teams and revise it based on constructive feedback from peers.

070678516527493980A902A6AF080868.description: Why it is important to consider future needs

36E51274A7174AFB89D113CBD5EEFF37.description: Managing system resources (e.g., memory, multitasking, multiprocessing)

A97AD5A94ABD47D889BB3591E7287F97.description: Guiding questions to determine the optimal software requirements

C9263E3A91E54DF0B37B349D9545A5F0.description:
In teams, research various types of network operating systems (NOS) (e.g., Microsoft
Windows server, Linux enterprise server, UNIX, etc.). Identify the basic functions of a NOS,
and synthesize the findings to write an explanatory text that includes, but is not limited to,
the following:

41C00BF57B05437CB4155B6EB5C0D81A.description:
Provide details of the multistep procedure and justify the plan by providing supporting
evidence that conforms to the Institute for Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) 802.11
standards.

04DA7841E21348E6AC68C03A228D5A75.description:
Given specifications to install and configure a wireless network in a large office, conduct a
site survey to assess requirements of the clients, facility characteristics, and coverage area.
Using the survey results, write and execute a plan that includes, but is not limited to, the
following:

9DCC485A268C492886C11025A9D25B3C.description:
Provide details of the multistep procedure and justify the recommendations in the plan by
providing supporting evidence that conforms to industry standards (e.g., Institute for
Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) 802.11, Bluetooth).

B0751F31716542F683CD819CDA348C79.description: Locate and place the access point

60957C601B764C6DB13AD9C06A699EA5.description:
Given specifications to install and configure a basic wireless network in a home or small
office, write and execute a plan that includes, but is not limited to, the following:

FCFEE0BA825A4A1AB6733002C585F130.description:
Explore Bluetooth technology, differentiating between purposes of, and standards that
govern, Bluetooth and other technologies (such as those governed by IEEE 802.111).

FDBF6CE7C61540DD8F570279E589CCC4.description:
Locate and access the 802.11 standards (wireless fidelity or Wi-Fi) developed by the Institute
for Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE). Explain the purpose of these standards, as well
as how IT professionals should apply them to networking systems.

EE29BA56F41C48108C77490123C67CCE.description:
Compare and contrast wireless local area network (WLAN) infrastructure to that of wired
network topologies. Identify and explain the differences between the two layout types.

21F68E9ECF49456EBA4E88E3005B5212.description: Narrowband, broadband, and spread spectrum signals

A1FE056560474CE0854BF80A873A44AE.description:
Demonstrate understanding of wireless transmission technology. Use a combination of
graphic illustrations and text to describe how a wireless signal originates from an electrical
current and travels along a conductor. Include definitions and functions of the following
concepts.

C6567C622561420D9460345D9AB7DCBD.description:
Identify common gateway devices and explain how they are different from connectivity
devices. Further, explain why the gateways must operate on multiple layers of the open
systems interconnection (OSI) model.

9A0E520EB45548F1B8FE38A250E609AF.description:
Create and execute a plan to first install multiple nodes to a small switch, and then to
connect the switch to another connectivity device. Verbally describe the steps of the
procedure as they are being demonstrated.

EC964F8E5A0841C4A8C1C42922E8D58C.description:
Compare and contrast bridges with repeaters and hubs, identifying examples of advantages
that bridges have over these devices. Provide supporting evidence to justify each example.

06BA3EF2793E4D368AA228441A78F0DE.description:
Define a repeater and explain its limitations. Describe the characteristics of a hub; explain
how it is a type of repeater, yet it still differs from the repeater. Install and configure the
following types of hubs and identify their distinguishing characteristics.

DD734283282347B5880DC0DC3A730FAE.description:
Research the following types of network interface cards (NICs). Create a table or other
graphic organizer that lists examples and characteristics of NICs, as well as steps to selecting
the appropriate NIC. Demonstrate proper installation and configuration of each device,
attending to appropriate measurements and units. Summarize the multistep procedure to
install and configure the various NICs.

E7AABE0CF8154D519DAF2C6F308654CD.description: Hybrid: enhanced interior gateway routing protocol (EIGRP)

4F15231CA594472EAB80F38C92D38D1D.description:
Distance-vector: routing information protocol (RIP), routing information protocol
version 2 (RIPv2), border gateway protocol (BGP)

DEDCA94C287F40E1983ABAE38CDD26EA.description:
Link-state: open shortest path first (OSPF), intermediate system to intermediate
system (IS-IS)

CDB2839296DA4CA9AA900C48103B0FB9.description:
Write descriptive text that outlines the process used to determine the most efficient path
(e.g., route) for data to flow across a network. Identify and describe that variables the
influence the best path, including the following most common routing protocols.

E524B31781A9461BABCE1F39210809D9.description:
Define routing and explain why a router is protocol dependent. Identify and list the
properties of a router and describe its basic functions, citing examples found in
informational texts.

510C5AA526C947C4A5579BE5AA1418B4.description:
Define switching and detail the role that it occupies in a logical network topology. Describe
the three types of switching (circuit, message, and packet) and identify the specific details
that distinguish how each method establishes paths between nodes.

C0DD65FECD8A48C1A7166AF06C5CA05F.description:
Compare and contrast logical network topologies to physical network topologies. Explain
how these two types of topologies differ. Identify the common logical network topologies
and describe their characteristics. Provide examples demonstrating how logical network
topologies are useful in troubleshooting.

78F9908ED46443EDBDDC74D155C25D4A.description:
Define each of the following physical network topologies, and draw diagrams to distinguish
among the layouts. Include examples of the most effective applications, as well as identify
the advantages and disadvantages of each topology.

EBD68DD25ABD496E99834D08B189F4E3.description:
Describe the following address formats: IPv6, IPv4, and MAC. Using the advantages and
disadvantages as supporting evidence, identify and explain the application of each format.

38AE70EE6CEC42A9970F5C90974EB007.description:
Research and identify the common subprotocols associated with transmission control
protocol (TCP) and internet protocol. Using a combination of text and graphic illustrations,
explain their functions and how they correlate to the layers of the open systems connection
(OSI) model. Examples of subprotocols include, but are not limited to: hypertext transfer
protocol (HTTP), user diagram protocol (UDP), internet control message protocol (ICMP),
internet group management protocol (IGMP), address resolution protocol (ARP), domain
name system (DNS), network time protocol (NTP), file transfer protocol (FTP), and trivial file
transfer protocol (TFTP).

D4AF31A081B04BE685323CD56D585B56.description:
Identify and describe a range of standard cable types (e.g., coaxial cable, shielded twisted
pair, unshielded twisted pair, single-mode fiber, multimode fiber, serial, plenum, and nonplenum), comparing and contrasting their characteristics and properties and differentiating
between them accurately. Explain why it is necessary to consider the following properties
when selecting and installing the appropriate cables for a networking task, and why these
decisions must conform to industry standards. For a given task and environment, make a
recommendation about an appropriate cable type and defend the recommendation with
specific evidence and reasoning.

1C8F51D0A3CB4D9A808E1E2139C32116.description:
Create and use diagrams to explain the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) Model and the
flow of data through it. Define the functions and identify the associated hardware
components of the OSI Model’s following seven layers. For example, explain how each layer
interacts to ensure that data arrives in the correct place without errors.

1DE8B837634C429CBB70F4AD2F89A5B1.description:
Describe the following functions provided by a network. Distinguish between these network
services in a large office versus an office with few users, providing specific examples.

467AFF054C314B8CB977FE958D5EA62B.description:
Define the term “network,” define and describe the necessary features and components of a
network, and differentiate between different network types. Using graphic illustrations, or
other diagrams, identify and describe the following types of networks, outlining the features
that distinguish each network from the others and effectively diagraming the flow of
information in each.

C26CB09238544118B0C54FCED58FF1C9.description: Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers

935BB255796B456797218E755279B693.description: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

CE96639FD43A4A768D60275E30B9B705.description: Electronic Industries Alliance and Telecommunications Industry Association

21F38A5DCEF94D628410F4BAE48037D3.description:
Research the following networking standards organizations and write an informative paper
explaining the industry standards that are managed by each. Describe why these standards
are important and how they influence the work of a network administrator or other IT
professional.

6BA8C8F7803C4194AE7A04B8300A918C.description:
Locate and access the Computer Technology Industry Association (CompTIA) website and
analyze its structure, policies, and requirements for CompTIA Network+ certification. Explain
what steps are required to obtain the certification, methods to prepare for the examination,
and how it can be a stepping stone to more advanced certifications.

A2EC5E935CE74BAAAC1BC0CFAD007BA3.description:
Identify and explain the intended use of safety equipment available in the classroom. For
example, demonstrate how to properly inspect, use, and maintain safe operating
procedures with tools and equipment.

EA859E671A63497893BAFEA34AEF107F.description:
Accurately read, interpret, and demonstrate adherence to safety rules, including but not
limited to rules published by the National Science Teachers Association (NSTA), rules
pertaining to electrical safety, Internet safety, Occupational Safety and Health Administration
(OSHA) guidelines, and state and national code requirements. Be able to distinguish between
rules and explain why certain rules apply. Complete safety test with 100 percent accuracy.
